meanings.definition: To pursue relentlessly or harass persistently.
meanings.sent1: The detective hounded the suspect until he confessed.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi hounded the celebrity for photos.
meanings.sent3: The persistent squirrel hounded the birds for their food.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts hounded her like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the embarrassing moment hounded him for days.

meanings.definition: To urge or drive on by harassing.
meanings.sent1: The coach hounded the players to give their best in the game.
meanings.sent2: The boss hounded the employees to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy hounded the cat to play with him.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker hounded the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The music hounded her to get up and dance with joy.
